Description: ADGM-regulated platform with Lebanese SPVs holding property deeds
Pros: Regulated by credible ADGM; Isolates Lebanese banking risk; Clear legal separation
Cons: Complex cross-jurisdictional structure; Requires specialized legal expertise

Description: Property onboarding → SPV creation → Custodian holding → Token issuance → Operations → Secondary market
Pros: Clear investor journey; Automated income distribution; Regulated custody
Cons: Multiple handoffs increase complexity; Each step requires legal validation

Description: Non-profit ADGM entity as sole shareholder of Lebanese SPVs
Pros: Provides stable ownership; Prevents commingling; Enables token holder governance
Cons: Adds operational complexity; Requires separate ADGM entity setup

Description: Detailed analysis of ADGM-Lebanese cross-border legal structure
Pros: Comprehensive legal analysis; Identifies critical gaps; Provides next steps
Cons: Complex technical document; Requires legal expertise to implement

Description: Structured questionnaire covering market, model, financials, team
Pros: Comprehensive framework; Identifies key information needed
Cons: Not yet filled out; Requires significant research and writing

Description: Year 1: 15 properties, $3M revenue; Year 3: 90 properties, $25M revenue
Pros: Shows clear path to profitability; Attractive growth trajectory; Investable metrics
Cons: High execution risk; Aggressive assumptions; Requires perfect sales performance

Description: RegLab → Full license progression for token issuance and custody
Pros: Credible regulatory framework; Clear licensing path; Investor protection
Cons: RegLab admission not guaranteed; High compliance costs; US persons excluded

Description: Legal bridge between ADGM Foundation, Lebanese SPV, and TLB platform
Pros: Creates enforceable governance link; Defines token holder rights; Establishes voting protocol
Cons: Complex multi-jurisdictional contract; Requires expert legal drafting

Description: Token purchase agreement, terms of service, privacy policy
Pros: Legal protection; Defines rights/obligations; Regulatory compliance
Cons: Complex drafting; Multiple jurisdictions; Legal review required

Description: Lebanese real estate market analysis, yields, legal framework
Pros: Validates underlying assets; Identifies opportunities; Risk assessment
Cons: Requires local expertise; Market volatility; Data availability

Description: KYC/AML procedures, ongoing monitoring, reporting
Pros: Regulatory requirement; Investor protection; Platform integrity
Cons: Complex implementation; Ongoing costs; Regulatory changes

Description: Key hires, advisors, and organizational chart
Pros: Essential for investor confidence; Defines execution capability
Cons: Founder has no relevant background; Critical risk factor

Description: Industry experts, legal advisors, regulatory consultants
Pros: Adds credibility; Provides guidance; Opens networks
Cons: Requires equity compensation; Time to recruit

Description: Technical specifications, security measures, scalability plan
Pros: Enables development; Ensures security; Investor due diligence
Cons: Complex development; Requires technical team; Security critical

Description: Detailed functionality for income distribution, voting, transfers
Pros: Core platform functionality; Automated operations
Cons: Requires audit; Complex logic; Security vulnerabilities

Description: Smart contract audit, platform security assessment
Pros: Ensures platform security; Builds trust; Investor requirement
Cons: Audit costs; Time-consuming; May reveal vulnerabilities

Description: Independent Lebanese company handling property operations
Pros: Eliminates Lebanese banking exposure; Professional property management; Tax compliance
Cons: Additional operational layer; Requires vetting and management oversight

Description: Restricted security token with built-in compliance features
Pros: Built-in KYC/AML restrictions; Regulatory compliant; Controlled transfers
Cons: Limited to whitelisted addresses; May reduce liquidity initially

Description: Concise value proposition and problem-solution statement
Pros: Clear messaging; Addresses key pain points; Professional presentation
Cons: Generic; Needs customization for different audiences

Description: 4-page overview of the tokenization process and benefits
Pros: Visual explanation; Step-by-step process; Clear benefits
Cons: High-level overview; Lacks technical depth; Needs investor-grade detail

Description: Detailed breakdown of startup costs, OPEX, and personnel requirements
Pros: Comprehensive cost tracking; Identifies key expense categories; Enables budget planning
Cons: High fixed costs; Heavy personnel expenses; Requires significant upfront capital

Description: Professional template with market-based assumptions for financial modeling
Pros: Provides realistic baseline; Professional presentation; Data-driven assumptions
Cons: Some assumptions may be optimistic; Requires market validation

Description: In-kind contribution of property to SPV to reduce tax burden
Pros: Potentially reduces tax from 6% to ~0.25%; Makes platform more competitive
Cons: Requires Lebanese legal opinion; Not guaranteed to be accepted by authorities

Description: ADGM law for platform/tokens; Lebanese law for property/SPV
Pros: Appropriate jurisdiction for each component; Clear dispute resolution
Cons: Dual legal systems increase complexity; Higher legal costs

Description: Minimal budget, single top-tier salesperson, founder network focus
Pros: Maximum capital efficiency; Low burn rate; Extreme focus on conversion
Cons: Single point of failure; No brand building; No plan B

Description: Detailed profiles: Strategic Patriarch, Pragmatic Local, Whales, Hamours, Sharks
Pros: Clear audience definition; Tailored messaging; Precise targeting
Cons: Multiple personas create complexity; May dilute focus

Description: Customer acquisition cost vs lifetime value calculations
Pros: Data-driven approach; Identifies profitability gaps; Enables optimization
Cons: Current LTV:CAC ratio unfavorable (0.81); Requires pricing/investment increase

Description: Token supply, distribution, utility, value accrual mechanisms
Pros: Defines token value; Investor incentives; Platform sustainability
Cons: Complex design; Regulatory considerations; Market acceptance

Description: Legal verification process for each property
Pros: Ensures clean title; Identifies risks; Standardizes process
Cons: Time-consuming; Legal costs; May disqualify properties

Description: Direct and indirect competitors, market positioning
Pros: Identifies differentiation; Market validation; Strategic positioning
Cons: Time-consuming research; May reveal market saturation

Description: Total/Serviceable/Obtainable market sizing
Pros: Quantifies opportunity; Investor requirement; Market validation
Cons: Requires market research; May show limited market size

Description: Due diligence, legal verification, SPV setup procedures
Pros: Standardizes operations; Ensures quality; Scalable process
Cons: Complex legal requirements; Time-intensive; Cost per property

Description: KYC/AML process, token purchase, dashboard access
Pros: Streamlines user experience; Ensures compliance; Professional presentation
Cons: Regulatory requirements; User friction; Technical complexity

Description: Wealth managers, real estate brokers, legal firms, tech providers
Pros: Accelerates growth; Adds credibility; Access to networks
Cons: Revenue sharing; Complex negotiations; Dependency risk

Description: Comprehensive risk assessment with mitigation strategies
Pros: Identifies threats; Enables planning; Shows due diligence
Cons: May reveal significant risks; Requires ongoing monitoring

Description: Balanced approach targeting diaspora patriarchs and local professionals
Pros: Comprehensive market coverage; Professional channels; Balanced tactics
Cons: High CAC; Budget spread too thin; Low conversion rates

Description: Data-driven precision strike targeting whales, hamours, and sharks
Pros: Highly targeted; Innovative intelligence hub; Quality over quantity
Cons: Complex to implement; High upfront costs; Requires specialized expertise

Description: Relationship-first approach leveraging founder network with A-player partner
Pros: Maximum trust via warm intros; High conversion rates; Focused approach
Cons: High cash burn; Dependent on A-player; Significant overhead

Description: Exchange partnerships, liquidity providers, market making
Pros: Provides exit strategy; Increases token value; Platform differentiation
Cons: Regulatory complexity; Liquidity challenges; Exchange costs

Description: Logo, visual identity, messaging, tone of voice
Pros: Professional presentation; Brand recognition; Trust building
Cons: Design costs; Time to develop; Requires consistency

Description: Educational content, thought leadership, investor resources
Pros: Builds authority; Educates market; SEO benefits
Cons: Time-intensive; Requires expertise; Slow ROI
